message.content:
cs.CG, cs.GR, cs.NA, cs.SC, cs.SY. 

The paper presents an algorithm for approximating complex curves with simple parametric curves, which is a common problem in computer-aided geometric design (CAGD), computer graphics (CG), and computer numerical control (CNC). Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the cs.CG (Computational Geometry) and cs.GR (Graphics) sub-categories. The algorithm involves optimization and error control, which suggests that it may also belong to the cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) sub-category. The paper also mentions preserving geometric features such as topology and singular points, which suggests that it may belong to the cs.SC (Symbolic Computation) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes an application for computing approximate implicit equations, which suggests that it may also belong to the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category.
